pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.3.1: “‘I will walk well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.4: One should be well-restrained while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands or feet while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.13: The fifth training rule is finished.
